title: Maclauring series for f(π) part - d

content.description: The Maclaurin series for f(x) is given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mi>x</mi> <mrow> <mn>2</mn> <mo>!</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>3</mn> <mo>!</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>4</mn> <mo>!</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mn>...</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mi>n</mi> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mi>n</mi> <mo>+</mo> <mn>1</mn> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> <mo>!</mo> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>+</mo> <mn>...</mn> </mrow> <annotation>MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaaGymaiabgU caRmaalaaabaGaamiEaaqaaiaaikdacaGGHaaaaiabgUcaRmaalaaa baGaamiEamaaCaaaleqabaGaaGOmaaaaaOqaaiaaiodacaGGHaaaai abgUcaRmaalaaabaGaamiEamaaCaaaleqabaGaaG4maaaaaOqaaiaa isdacaGGHaaaaiabgUcaRiaac6cacaGGUaGaaiOlaiabgUcaRmaala aabaGaamiEamaaCaaaleqabaGaamOBaaaaaOqaaiaacIcacaWGUbGa ey4kaSIaaGymaiaacMcacaGGHaaaaiabgUcaRiaac6cacaGGUaGaai Olaaaa@5022@</annotation> </semantics> </math>
content.question: Write g(x) in terms of a familiar function without using series. Then, write f(x) in terms of the same familiar function.
